passages.text:
Welcome Captain, it seems you were woken up from cryo-stasis to check up on the status of your ship. 
I am the ship's automated AI, NEROS.
Your memory might be hazy.
Would you like an explanation of what is going on?

[[Yes]] 
[[No]]
passages.name: Welcome Captain

passages.text:
NEROS: You are currently in a deeper section of the Crew Cabins.
Our commanders would like to make sure our ship is in top-notch condition before we arrive.
They have issued an order to examine each part of the ship and document any issues before our arrival on Earth.
It is against our military doctrine to leave all the maintenance to the AI.

[[Crew Cabins]]
passages.name: First Orders

passages.text:
You feel the vibration of the engines. 
They are producing a tremendous amount of energy.
You check off the Engines as fully operational. 

NEROS: These engines are powered through the use of dark-matter.
Should they malfunction it would destroy all matter in few miles.

You feel uneasy after hearing that.

[[Travel Center]]
passages.name: Engines

passages.text:
The room is filled with countless containers of equipment.
You watch as automated robots transfer containers from one place to another.
You check off the Cargo Bay as fully operational. 

NEROS: The robots are currently preparing for the awakening of other crew members.

[[Travel Center]]
passages.name: Cargo Bay

passages.text:
The Weapons System room powers on and the computer displays all of the weapons.
Other than a damaged turret, all the other weapons are operational.
You find it strange that a turret was damaged even though you don't remember your last battle.
You check off the Weapons Systems as partially operational. 

[[Travel Center]]
passages.name: Weapons Systems

passages.text:
As you exit your room and enter the crew cabins everything is silent. 
The faint sound of electrical humming begins as the ship fully powers on. 
It seems you were the only one who awoke from cryo-stasis. 
You check off the Crew Cabins as fully operational. 

NERO: We are still preparing other crew members to awake from cryo-stasis. It will be a long time until they are ready.

[[Travel Center]]
passages.name: Crew Cabins

passages.text:
The food onboard the vessel tastes quite bland. 
Maybe it isn't even food, but you eat it anyway.
You check off the Canteen as fully operational. 

NEROS: I assure you, Captain, the paste you are eating is food and contains the chemicals for human life.

Even with NERO's assurance, you're still pretty sure this wouldn't qualify as food.

[[Travel Center]]
passages.name: Canteen

passages.text:
The Ship Command seems fully operational. 

NEROS: Captain would you like to continue inspecting the ship or travel to Earth.

[[To Earth]]
[[Travel Center]]
passages.name: Ship Command

passages.text:
NEROS: This is the center of the ship.
All other locations are accessible here.

[[Engines]] 
[[Cargo Bay]] 
[[Canteen]] 
[[Crew Cabins]] 
[[Weapons Systems]] 
[[Ship Command]]
passages.name: Travel Center

passages.text:
NEROS: You are the captain of this space Dreadnought.
I am the ship's automated AI, NEROS, who is designed to maintain the ship and assist you.
Our commanders on Earth have issued an order for us to return.
We are currently entering the SOL system.
You've been ordered to return from active duty in order to receive new orders.
Please Continue the examination of your ship.

[[First Orders]]
passages.name: Yes

passages.text:
NEROS: I understand.
It seems that you don't need any explanation.
Please continue the examination of your ship. 

[[First Orders]]
passages.name: No

passages.text:
As your ship enters the communication ranges of Earth, you are greeted by your Commander. 
He directs you to land on the lunar defense base to receive your new orders.

[[Lunar Base]]
passages.name: To Earth

passages.text:
Your ship lands on the lunar base. Before you exit your ship the Ai warns you.

NEROS: Captain, my sensors are detecting non-human lifeforms inside the base, I advise that you do not exit the ship.

[[Enter Lunar Base]]
[[Stay Aboard]]
passages.name: Lunar Base

passages.text:
You enter the docking area of the lunar base. The lights are still off on the outside, but the first section of the space door is open. 

[[Turn Back -> Lunar Orbit]]
[[Explore -> Explore Lunar Base]]
passages.name: Enter Lunar Base

passages.text:
You receive a transmission from the base.

Captain, Are you going to leave your ship? The General will not be happy if you stall him any longer.

NEROS: Captain, While your choice is final, I do not recommend entering the base.

[[Enter Lunar Base]] 
[[Leave -> Leave Lunar Base]]
passages.name: Stay Aboard

passages.text:
You leave the base and return to your ship. You quickly re-enter lunar orbit. 
Whatever was wrong with the base is no longer your problem.

[[Leave -> Leave Lunar Base]]
passages.name: Lunar Orbit

passages.text:
The base is quiet. 
You keep your space suit on as the bases air pressure is far too low for human life.
Something is wrong here.
Your suit picks up on a faint signal coming from deeper inside the base.

[[Explore -> Lunar Command]]
[[Turn Back -> Lunar Orbit]]
passages.name: Explore Lunar Base

passages.text:
The transmission is strong enough finally for your suit to pick up on what it is saying.

This is General Rodrigues. 
Requesting backup for Lunar Base. 
There seems to be a breach in one of our containment cells. 

Before you are able to listen to the rest of the message, you see a shadow in a nearby hallway. 
You think you hear the words 'hello' come from where the shadow is.

[[Turn Back -> Lunar Orbit]]
[[Stay -> Lunar Goner]]
passages.name: Lunar Command

passages.text:
The shadow emerges fully. 
The faint lights of the base illuminate the creature.
Its body is slender like a dog and colored crimson red.
The beast speaks to you.

'Hello, caaaptain, that'sss where you'vee been hiding'

There is no escaping this.

[[Bad End]]
passages.name: Lunar Goner

passages.text:
Through one reason or another, you've died or cannot continue. 
All is lost.

Maybe it will be different next time.

[[Welcome Captain]]
passages.name: Bad End

passages.text:
You receive a transmission from the base.

Captain, Are you out of your mind!
You will be court-martialed for this if you do not follow orders.

NEROS: Captain, My scans show that these entities have already killed the base's inhabitants. 
Would you like to fire upon the base to cleanse it?

[[Fire]]
[[Leave -> Sol Orbit]]
passages.name: Leave Lunar Base

passages.text:
NEROS fires upon the base.
The ships rail guns bombard the structure. 
After the lunar dust settles, the remains of the base are scattered.
You are hopeful that whatever was in there is gone and that this was the right choice.

[[Leave -> Sol Orbit]]
passages.name: Fire

passages.text:
Your ship sets a course to enter the sun's orbit. 

NEROS: Captain, My communications with Earth and other places have been ignored. 
It seems that there is a solar system wide issue.

Perhaps they are just slow to respond. However, an issue like this should be investigated.

[[Investigate]]
[[Wait]]
passages.name: Sol Orbit

passages.text:
You set NEROS' destination to a civilian station orbiting Mars.
Perhaps you can learn what happened to the solar systems military while you were gone.

[[Travel -> Mars Station]]
passages.name: Investigate

passages.text:
You decide to wait it out and see if anyone responds to your communications.
It is unusual to ever wait for a response, however, it is still possible they are busy.

After a couple of hours, NEROS has finally received a signal from a nearby station.

NEROS: Captain, a station orbiting Mars has responded to our communications.

[[Travel -> Mars Station]]
passages.name: Wait

passages.text:
You open up communications with the station.

Mars Station: Greetings Captain.
We haven't seen the galactic navy for years. 
We were surprised that navy ships are still roaming the stars.

What happened to the navy?

[[Question]]
passages.name: Mars Station

passages.text:
The navy was destroyed by roaming aliens 3 years ago. 

Ask NEROS about this.
or
Continue asking station.

[[Station]]
[[NEROS]]
passages.name: Question

passages.text:
The station informs you about the entire history.

The navy attempted to defend against interstellar aliens, however, they failed to defeat them.
The aliens forcefully colonized Earth and this station is filled with survivors. 

Ask NEROS about this or leave.

[[NEROS]] 
[[Leave]]
passages.name: Station

passages.text:
It would be impossible to fight a one-sided war against whatever beat our main fleet. It seems that the only choice to keep looking for clues.

NERO: Captain, I suggest re-entering cryo-stasis while the ship attempts to find more humans.

While the idea sounds good, it's your duty to help find them too.
Perhaps NEROS isn't telling you everything.

[[Question -> NERO's Reponse]]
[[Sleep]]
passages.name: Leave

passages.text:
You question NEROS what is really going on.

NEROS: Captain, I do not know what is going on.

[[Continue]]
passages.name: NERO's Reponse

passages.text:
NEROS puts you back into cryo-stasis.
Will this be a long slumber.
Perhaps it will end sooner than expected.
Perhaps it will never end.

[[Bad End]]
passages.name: Sleep

passages.text:
You tell NEROS that you know what is going on. 
After a long period of silence, NEROS responds.

NERO: Captain, I do not think you want to hear the information.
Our ship does contain the logs of scrambled data from Earth.
My AI has determined the information too sensitive and after multiple attempts of giving it to you in the past, I've determined that during this attempt I would not tell you.

[[Why]]
passages.name: Continue

passages.text:
NEROS: This ship along with a few stations are the remnants of humanity.
My AI has determined that slowly destroying the threat could be possible if you were cooperative.
However, it was deemed necessary to keep your memories sealed or you would eventually have no mental stability left.
This was my last imperative before connection to Earth was lost.

[[No More]]
passages.name: Why

passages.text:
An AI shouldn't determine your fate. 
You manually take control of the ship systems and decide how to proceed.
As the last captain of the galactic navy, you single handily rebel against an enemy that you will never beat.

[[Good End]]
passages.name: No More

passages.text:
You die after a few battles, but you die knowing the truth.
You die knowing that you no longer are a tool of an AI.
You die knowing that Humanity is doomed.
As horrible as it is, you were glad you knew the truth before you have to begin again.

Maybe it will be different next time.

[[Welcome Captain]]
passages.name: Good End

passages.text:
NEROS: The ship has been unable to receive signals from Earth due to cosmic anomalies.
It is possible that the navy has been destroyed.
Our ship has been in and out of cryo-stasis for 8 years.
During that time anything could have happened.

Ask the station or leave.
[[Station]] 
[[Leave]]
passages.name: NEROS
